articles.title: Rents Are Out Of Reach For Most Americans Earning Minimum Wage, A Study Says - NPR
articles.description: Workers simply don't earn enough money to keep up with skyrocketing rental rates across the country, the National Low Income Housing Coalition found in its latest Out of Reach report.
articles.content:
A new study says on average someone would have to earn $24.90 per hour to rent a modest two-bedroom home on no more than 30% of their pay. That's far more than the federal minimum wage.
Rich Pedronc… [+2565 chars]
